task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block, approach and align the circular end-effector, then push the block toward the target zone and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-like arm with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar white workspace until it reaches a marked target region. The behavior tree first ensures the block is perceived; if not, it performs a raster scan. The arm moves to a safe height above the block, aligns precisely, orients the tool, and executes a single diagonal push. After the push, the goal region is checked for visibility as a proxy for contextual verification, and the arm retreats to clear the scene. Observations and control are effectively discrete at 10 Hz.
preconditions: Block is on the table within camera view
End-effector is free and above the table
Target region is marked on the surface
stepwise_plan: Perceive the T-block; scan if not visible.
Move above the block with safe clearance.
Approach and fine-align to the push contact line.
Set tool yaw to 90° and verify orientation.
Push the block diagonally toward the target.
Optionally verify scene context and retreat.
success_criteria: Block translated in the intended direction and approximately toward/into the target region
No loss of contact with workspace
Arm ends in a safe, non-interfering pose
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure → raster scan and re-detect
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds after executing the push and retreat without errors.

frame_3.now_evidence: Contact geometry and alignment just before push are clearly visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation is imminent; confirms intended diagonal direction.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Check whether the T-block is visible.
Raster scan to localize the T-block.
Move to a safe height above the block.
Refine pose and align for pushing.
Orient the tool for a planar push.
Execute a diagonal push toward the goal.
Context check that goal region is visible.
Back off to a safe, neutral pose.

recovery_strategy: Re-approach and re-align before another push
Adjust push angle/distance via subsequent runs
Retreat if unexpected contact is sensed
assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target—treated as the same objects.
Push direction chosen as 225° (down-left) based on apparent goal outline position.
Verification uses visibility of goal region due to lack of an explicit 'object-at-goal' condition in the library.

expected_success_criteria: The T-block shifts toward/into the goal outline after a single push
